section.title: Error Values
section.t: NFS error numbers are assigned to failed operations within a Compound (COMPOUND or CB_COMPOUND) request. A Compound request contains a number of NFS operations that have their results encoded in sequence in a Compound reply. The results of successful operations will consist of an NFS4_OK status followed by the encoded results of the operation. If an NFS operation fails, an error status will be entered in the reply and the Compound request will be terminated.

section.title: General Errors
section.t: This section deals with errors that are applicable to a broad set of different purposes.

section.title: NFS4ERR_UNION_NOTSUPP (Error Code 10090)
section.t: One of the arguments to the operation is a discriminated union and while the server supports the given operation, it does not support the selected arm of the discriminated union.

section.title: Server to Server Copy Errors
section.t: These errors deal with the interaction between server to server copies.

section.title: NFS4ERR_OFFLOAD_DENIED (Error Code 10091)
section.t: The copy offload operation is supported by both the source and the destination, but the destination is not allowing it for this file. If the client sees this error, it should fall back to the normal copy semantics.

section.title: NFS4ERR_OFFLOAD_NO_REQS (Error Code 10094)
section.t: The copy offload operation is supported by both the source and the destination, but the destination can not meet the client requirements for either consecutive byte copy or synchronous copy. If the client sees this error, it should either relax the requirements (if any) or fall back to the normal copy semantics.

section.title: NFS4ERR_PARTNER_NO_AUTH (Error Code 10089)
section.t: The source server does not authorize a server-to-server copy offload operation. This may be due to the client's failure to send the COPY_NOTIFY operation to the source server, the source server receiving a server-to-server copy offload request after the copy lease time expired, or for some other permission problem.

section.title: NFS4ERR_PARTNER_NOTSUPP (Error Code 10088)
section.t: The remote server does not support the server-to-server copy offload protocol.

section.title: Labeled NFS Errors
section.t: These errors are used in Labeled NFS.

section.title: NFS4ERR_BADLABEL (Error Code 10093)
section.t: The label specified is invalid in some manner.

section.title: NFS4ERR_WRONG_LFS (Error Code 10092)
section.t: The LFS specified in the subject label is not compatible with the LFS in the object label.

section.title: New Operations and Their Valid Errors
section.t: This section contains a table that gives the valid error returns for each new NFSv4.2 protocol operation. The error code NFS4_OK (indicating no error) is not listed but should be understood to be returnable by all new operations. The error values for all other operations are defined in Section 15.2 of .

section.title: New Callback Operations and Their Valid Errors
section.t: This section contains a table that gives the valid error returns for each new NFSv4.2 callback operation. The error code NFS4_OK (indicating no error) is not listed but should be understood to be returnable by all new callback operations. The error values for all other callback operations are defined in Section 15.3 of .

texttable.preamble: Valid Error Returns for Each New Protocol Callback Operation
texttable.c: NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE, NFS4ERR_BADXDR, NFS4ERR_BAD_STATEID, NFS4ERR_DELAY, NFS4ERR_OP_NOT_IN_SESSION, NFS4ERR_REP_TOO_BIG, NFS4ERR_REP_TOO_BIG_TO_CACHE, NFS4ERR_REQ_TOO_BIG, NFS4ERR_RETRY_UNCACHED_REP, NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT, NFS4ERR_TOO_MANY_OPS
